title: How to get just the vocals of a song - Quora

response.answer_text: either way its going to cost the music must be removed if you know of their fan club someone there can usually do it but they will ask for money and also how famous is the vocalist sounds strange but if they’re huge then getting it could be easier the studios will tell you nick off so best bet is the younger fans it’s amazing what they can do simply today try Ebay you will be surprised but the fan club is your best bet I had someone give just vocals so they can do it and no they can’t he is no longer on this earth sorry you tube also the kids on there all trying to get known

Its a complicated process and does not work very well. The quality is greatly affected and is reduced significantly. A vocal is mixed in the center track of a song and is usually of a prominent level ,making it an integral part of the whole song. If you want the vocal track of a song, you should look for “stems” or “vocal acapella” on the web, many services provide users with stems. A stem is purely an isolated track with just the sound, eg: only the guitar lead of a song, or just the recorded vocals of the song, or just the snare drums in the song etc.

A CAPELLA!  Image source: Google The word you are looking for is “Acapella/A capella” (Spelt either way). Acapella stands for the vocals that are used in a song. A song with only vocals and no instruments or background sounds is known as "Acapellan mix”. To just get the vocals of a song, follow the below steps: Go to GoogleSearch for the particular song’s vocals you want. E.g ( Linkin park: Numb Acapella)OPTIONAL: Visit Your #1 Resource for FREE Acapellas to Download - ACAPELLAS4uVisit: Free mp3 studio acapellasSearch for the required song.Download mp3 or wav form of the vocals.There you go. Enjoy!

Go to Google Type the song that you want vocals of , add tge word Acapella at the end and boom there you go ,you will have your vocals to that songs Only some songs might not be found in their acapella version as they are too old or for any other issues. But mostly you can find all the songs Hope it helps!

One way you could this provided you have the studio quality instrumentals is by reversing it's polarity and then placing it right below the original song on Audacity. Both the tracks need to be synched. The end result is the acapella without any instruments. But the problem here is finding the studio quality instrumentals.

you can usually just go on YouTube and search for the song you want but saying “vocals only”. Hopefully there should be a vocals only track there for you to use. Make sure it isn’t copyrighted though.
